## Protein Links Module Overview

This module allows users to query the corresponding UniProt entry based on a **Gene ID** or **Protein Sequence**, and quickly access commonly used protein annotation and structural prediction tools:

- **UniProt**: Comprehensive protein information database  
- **InterPro**: Protein domain annotation platform  
- **Swiss-Model**: Tertiary structure prediction platform  

If the UniProt ID is not provided, users can input a protein sequence, and the system will automatically identify the most likely UniProt entry using local **BLASTP**.

---


### 1. Enter Gene ID or UniProt Accession

Input a standard **Gene ID** (e.g., `AT5G22800`) or **UniProt ID** (e.g., `P12345`) into the text box.

The system will automatically query the UniProt API to retrieve the corresponding protein entry.

![](https://pic1.imgdb.cn/item/68c81cfcc5157e1a8807df37.png) 

---

### 2. Enter Protein Sequence (Optional)

If a valid ID is not provided, you can paste a **protein primary sequence** (e.g., `MASTR...`).

The system will perform a local **BLASTP** search using both **SwissProt** and **TrEMBL** databases to identify the best matching UniProt entry.

⚠️ Note: This feature requires pre-downloaded UniProt databases and correctly configured paths (see below).

---

### 3. Configure Database Paths

- **SwissProt database path**: High-quality manually curated UniProt database  
  Example: `G:/blastdb/UniProt/uniprot_sprot`

- **TrEMBL database path**: Automatically annotated UniProt database  
  Example: `G:/blastdb/UniProt/uniprot_trembl`

- **BLASTp executable path**: Local BLAST executable file path  
  Example: `F:/NCBI/blast-2.17.0+/bin/blastp.exe`

Click **Run BLASTP** to start the sequence alignment.

---

### 4. Quick Links

Once a UniProt ID is identified, the system will generate buttons linking to:

- <span style="color:blue">**UniProt**</span>: View general protein information  
 
![](https://pic1.imgdb.cn/item/68c81d59c5157e1a8807e003.png)  

- <span style="color:skyblue">**InterPro**</span>: View domain annotations (Pfam, SMART, etc.)  
![](https://pic1.imgdb.cn/item/68c81d80c5157e1a8807e030.png)  

- <span style="color:orange">**Swiss-Model**</span>: Access tertiary structure modeling  
![](https://pic1.imgdb.cn/item/68c81d99c5157e1a8807e059.png)

Click the buttons to navigate to the corresponding protein page.

---

### 5. Error Handling

If a valid UniProt ID cannot be determined, the following message will appear:

No UniProt ID found. Please check your input.


Please ensure the Gene ID or sequence is valid and that the database paths are correctly set.

---

### Recommended Usage

- It is recommended to input a standard Gene ID (e.g., TAIR, ENSEMBL, LOC) or a UniProt Accession;
- Sequence-based BLAST is intended as a fallback and depends on the completeness and accuracy of local BLAST databases;
- Regular updates of local databases are recommended to ensure high BLAST matching success rates.
